rgb_hsl.color

Class RGBColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • rgb_hsl.color.Color
      • rgb_hsl.color.RGBColor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HexColor

    public class RGBColor
extends Color
    Subclass of Color. Uses integer values for red, blue and green and compensates for any remainder. Elements in RGB space are ordered triplets, where each component is on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Noah Teshima

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RGBColor()
      Default constructor.
      RGBColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Set the red, green, and blue values of the current color to their corresponding values.
      RGBColor(RGBColor color)
      Create an RGB color with the same values as the given reference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RGBColor

        public RGBColor()
        Default constructor. When invoked, the current instance is set to have a shade of black, with the RGB triplet of (0, 0, 0).

      • RGBColor

        public RGBColor(RGBColor color)
        Create an RGB color with the same values as the given reference. Specifically, the RGB element will have the same ordered triplet as the given reference. However, a deep copy is created, so two distinct references will have the same position in RGB space.
        Parameters:
        color - RGBColor reference containing the RGB values to copy.

      • RGBColor

        public RGBColor(int red,
                int green,
                int blue)
        Set the red, green, and blue values of the current color to their corresponding values. Elements in RGB space are ordered triplets, where each component is on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Parameters:
        red - integer value containing the amount of red
        green - integer value containing the amount of green
        blue - integer value containing the amount of blue

    • Method Detail

      • setColor

        public void setColor(double red,
                     double green,
                     double blue)
        Set the amount of red, green, and blue. This sets the position of the given instance in RGB space.
        Specified by:
        setColor in class Color
        Parameters:
        red - integer value containing the amount of red
        green - integer value containing the amount of green
        blue - integer value containing the amount of blue

      • getRed

        public int getRed()
        Get the amount of red in the current RGB color. The amount of red is guaranteed to be on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Returns:
        integer value containing the amount of red.

      • setRed

        public void setRed(int red)
        Mutator method used to set the new amount of red in the current RGB Color, on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Parameters:
        red - integer value containing the new amount of red.

      • getGreen

        public int getGreen()
        Get the amount of green in the current RGB color. The amount of green is guaranteed to be on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Returns:
        integer value containing the amount of green.

      • setGreen

        public void setGreen(int green)
        Set the new amount of green in the current RGB Color, on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Parameters:
        green - integer value containing the new amount of green.

      • getBlue

        public int getBlue()
        Get the amount of blue in the current RGB color. The amount of blue is guaranteed to be on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Returns:
        integer value containing the amount of blue.

      • setBlue

        public void setBlue(int blue)
        Set the new amount of blue in the current RGB Color, on the range [0, 255], inclusive.
        Parameters:
        blue - integer value containing the new amount of blue.

      • getHSLColor

        public HSLColor getHSLColor()
        Get the corresponding color in an HSL color space. This is a linear transformation between RGB and HSL color spaces, and represents the equivalent form in HSL space.
        Returns:
        HSLColor object that corresponds to the current instance's RGB values.

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
